document_data.name: Tiger's Claws
document_data.mainbody: '''Tiger's claws''', otherwise known as '''bagh nakh''', were a special type of small [[weapon]] unique to the land of [[Zakhara]].
document_data.Description:
Tiger's claws were straps or gloves fitted with spikes,{{Cite dragon/189/Rhino's Armor, Tiger's Claws|37}} This bar was connected along the wearer's palm and back of hand by a metal strip that was attached to another bracelet-type bar that went around the wearerâ€™s wrist.{{Cite dragon/61/Or with a weird one|19}}

The claws were were situated in such a way that they emerged between a wearer's fingers whenever they made a fist,
document_data.Weaponology:
Tiger's claws were typically used for assassinations, rather than in warfare. The most common form of an attack with them was an upward slash.

Though similar in appearance to the [[nekode]] of [[Kara-tur]], tiger's claws could not assist their wearer in acts of climbing.
document_data.Notable Tiger's Claws: * ''[[claws of the shadow]]'': An [[Item enchantment|enchanted]] set of bagh nakh that were used by cultists of [[Kiga]].
document_data.Notable Users: * Since these weapons were small and easily concealed, they were favored by slayers and [[assassin]]s, who often coated the spikes with [[poison]].
document_data.Price: In the land of Zakhara a pair of tiger's claws generally sold for 6 [[silver]] pieces. Outside this region they were considered exotic and thus fetched a much higher price, going as high as 5 [[gold]] pieces.
